Product Solutions Specialists work in partnership with the Global Corporate Bank & TS Sales organizations to structure cash deposit, concentration structures including physical/notional pooling, virtual accounts and investment solutions for their clients both within the APAC region and globally. The Product Solutions Specialist role is responsible for the development and execution of JP Morgan’s liquidity and account management proposition; to enhance market share and retain the bank’s leading position in the global and regional liquidity management space. This role is focused on providing specialized advisory during the Sales process for regionally integrated liquidity and account solutions including on-balance sheet deposits, cash concentration and virtual account management. Morgan’s share of our clients liquidity wallet by cross selling with other regions and across JPM Lines of Business products • Provide thought leadership and deliver market expertise to drive product innovation and platform transformation initiatives Risk, Regulatory & Remediation Management • Serve as market expert for regulations and market trends impacting liquidity management for global Corporations • Ensure understanding of the risk attributes to Liquidity products and the client segments utilising the product • Contribute to a robust risk & control environment and demonstrate expected risk & control behaviours • Identify, escalate and remediate any issues in a timely manner • Implement business of inclusion, best practices across the wider regional liquidity team and extended stakeholder group Sales and Marketing • Foster deeper understanding, in partnership with Treasury Solutions, of how liquidity products integrate with wider cash and investment management such as payments, custody, Trade, FX and translate to wins • Partner with corporate bankers and treasury sales to proactively identify and pursue new sales opportunities, understand client buying and usage behaviour, and the impact of regulations on their decisions • Demonstrate ability to actively engage in cross-functional dialogues involving current market dynamics with senior audience within client organisations • Provide regular updates on Regulatory Environment and Impact on Liquidity • Create focused programs to support effective sales targeting and delivery of balance/ revenue plans including product updates and training • Increase visibility with clients and in the industry, including client visits/feedback. Job_Title: Global Environmental and Social Risk Management - Associate - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job description J.P. Morgan’s Global Environmental & Social Risk Management (GESRM) team has a global mandate for reviewing transactions for environmental and social risk across the firm including the Corporate and Investment Bank (CIB), Commercial Banking, Business Banking and Asset & Wealth Management. The team are primarily based in London, with members in New York and Singapore, and currently review all relevant transactions and clients globally. The team’s primary mandate is to ensure transactions meet the firm’s Environmental and Social Risk Policy requirements, thereby safeguarding the firm’s reputation. Financial products covered include equity and debt underwriting, loans and credit facilities and some M&A activity. Sector coverage includes mining and metals, oil and gas, agriculture, forestry & pulp and paper. The candidate will be responsible for assessing deals under guidance of the more senior members of the team. Eventually, the candidate will be expected to undertake their own transactions and client reviews. The candidate will be primarily responsible for assessing Asia Pacific deals and supporting strategic initiatives and thematic reviews undertaken by the rest of the team. The individual needs to be a self starter, able to articulate thoughts clearly and have excellent attention to detail. The candidate will have a sound working knowledge and interest in environmental and social issues. In addition to GESRM responsibilities, the candidate will be a part of the CIB Reputation Risk Office (CIB RRO). The APAC CIB RRO is part of a CIB-aligned oversight function that owns the application of the Firmwide Reputation Risk Governance Policy for the CIB across the APAC region, and supports the escalation, review and disposition of reputation risk issues. The individual will be interfacing with a variety of internal counterparts across the firm as well as with clients. The role may involve some limited travel and is an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to a broad spectrum of industries across multiple asset classes and geographies. Key Responsibilities: • Assessing environmental and social risk in transactions • Assessing the environmental and social risk profile and performance of clients • Supporting the team on advising clients on environmental and social issues where relevant • Providing training to staff on environmental and social risk and the Firmwide Reputation Risk Governance Framework • Support with deep dives/ thematic reviews, researching a range of environmental and social issues and thematic topics that affect the Bank’s clients including human rights, supply chain issues, deforestation, climate change etc. • Interface with the business, namely front office, to advise on matters that may have a reputation risk component • Partner with other Reputation Risk Offices in North America and EMEA to discuss issues and themes relevant to APAC transactions and businesses, and assist with prioritized reputation risk projects across the regions. • Assist with logistics set up of various Reputation Risk Committee (RRC) meetings, follow-ups, minutes, and record-keeping. • Provide input into the preparation of a variety of reporting required monthly, quarterly or annually to Risk Committees, senior management, JPM’s Board and/or regulators. Desired Skills and Experience: • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g. environmental studies, sustainability, geography, development economics, finance) • 3+ years of previous environmental and social risk / sustainability experience in a relevant industry such as financial services or consultancy • Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of environmental and social issues • Good understanding and working knowledge of APAC-relevant environmental and social issues, such as human rights and/or deforestation risk in supply chains • Strong client and commercial focus • Ability to convey information clearly, accurately and succinctly (both written and verbally) • Good understanding of banking products and decision making processes • Working knowledge of environmental and social issues and operating practices across a range of sectors • Working knowledge of the Equator Principles, IFC Performance Standards and other relevant banking and corporate sustainability initiatives • Excellent analytical (proficient in Excel, large datasets and other third party sources such as Bloomberg) and interpersonal skills • Ability to draft high quality presentations and documentation • Preferred additional Chinese language skills to assist with conducting client/transaction due diligence with Chinese speaking internal and external stakeholders. • We’re a global company whose primary business language is English and so fluency in English is required To apply for this position, please use the following URL: https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=f5ed892983e7d568e147a82a6fae26a0

Job Description Customer Value Manager • Based in Singapore , the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on The Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021). •    Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years. •    Engage diverse communities to build vaccines confidence and uptake. •    Lead community engagements aligned to Brand strategies to enable broader consumer awareness, leveraging digital technologies and partnerships •    Innovate & partner to complement and enhance value in vaccines ecosystem, continue to expand beyond conventional delivery models. Our Marketing team are passionate about bringing our medicines and vaccines to our customers around the world. Through digital listening and patient analytics, we can understand our customers’ needs and strive to provide solutions to meet them. THE OPPORTUNITY: SG-MY Vaccines is committed towards the goal of reducing the burden of vaccines preventable diseases through stakeholder engagement and partnerships. Working cross-functionally we are inventing new ways of interacting with our customers and patients through various channels and technologies. In this role, you get to be an extension of marketing and the face of the company, promoting the mission of Vaccines to HCP and consumers. Working in networks across functions raises your professional profile and broaden access to future opportunities in a top-ranked biopharmaceutical company. WHAT YOU WILL DO (it is included but not limited as below mentioned): •    Identify relevant communities for engagements, develop, coordinate, and implement virtual and in-person trainings, workshops, conferences, and other events and initiatives that raises awareness for vaccines preventable diseases in coordination with multiple partners, including the management of event, registration, attendance, payments, etc. •    Ensuring programs are responsive to customer needs and the changing market landscape. •    Engage cross-functional teams (Policy & Access, Regulatory, Communication, Sales and Commercial Operations) to develop integrated Customer and Patient engagement plan. •    Define and track meaningful metrics to demonstrate tangible results and return on spend. •    Drive interactive campaigning and community building to amplify the buzz linked to our social campaigns. •    Development of business plans for Corporate and Tertiary/School health programs with the aim of promoting vaccination. •    Develop in partnership with medical, obtain approvals for outreach contents & messages •    Extend company digital assets to HCP community. •    Build a strong network of like-minded partners - HCP, patient advocates, professional societies, NGOs, insurance companies ready to partner and support community engagements. WHAT YOU MUST HAVE •    Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, communications, public relations, or a closely related field. •    Work experience in program management, public relations, marketing, engagement, or a related professional area. •    Demonstrated experience developing high-quality content, both written and multi-media. •    Demonstrated experience with managing the outreach, engagement, and/or marketing of a complex program. •    Proven ability to work cross-functionally and cross-regionally – with the ability to influence and lead change while building strong cross-functional partnerships. You must also be a creative thinker, with confidence and ability to challenge established thinking. •    Strong project and people management skills, with intellectual curiosity and the ability to create a vision as well as execute complex initiatives in matrix structures and the capability to get things done in an ethical and compliant way. •    Experience with content management systems as well as software programs (inDesign, •    Photoshop, and Adobe Illustrator) and producing a podcast. •    Ability to work independently with little supervision and multi-task, while coping with interruptions. •    Flexibility to adapt to sudden changes in planning •    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. •    Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Publisher, and Access). •    Excellent detail-oriented, organizational, and administrative skills to operate effectively in a fast-paced, multi-faceted work environment. •    Positive attitude, good interpersonal skills, and strong customer-focus •    Track record of high performance and achievement of objectives •    Fluency in English, both spoken and written. Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide. WHO WE ARE We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world. WHAT WE LOOK FOR Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us — and start making your impact today. Company Description Vitol is a leader in the energy sector with a presence across the spectrum; from oil through to power, renewables and carbon. It trades 8 million barrels per day of crude oil and products and, at any time, has 250 ships transporting its cargoes. Vitol’s clients include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves clients from some 40 offices worldwide and is invested in energy assets globally including: circa 16mm3 of storage globally, 480kbpd of refining capacity, 7,000 service stations and a growing portfolio of transitional and renewable energy assets. Revenues in 2019 were $225 billion. For more information: www.vitol.com Job Description Please note - no relocation/ permit assistance is provided of this position! The Research Analyst position is a key entry level role , enabling strong candidates to get immersed in a P&L driven environment, develop core analytical skills, and build up knowledge of the oil markets. The core contribution is to maintain and develop our systems for monitoring the international flows of our products. In particular, quality-checking and inputting requires attention to detail; further developing our vessel tracking algorithms requires technical and programming skills; whilst reporting and engaging with the trading teams requires great communication and relationship skills. The role is also characterised by a fair amount of ad-hoc research and commercial contributions. Responsibilities include: Perform gathering and reporting of diverse data sources including oil market surveys, financial reports and other publications for a better understanding of the market. Perform tracking of flows of all traded and certain non-traded product grades in East of Suez, as well as arb flows from the Atlantic Basin, leveraging on in-house and external ship tracking tools. Build and maintain a central database for tracking, reporting and analyzing all product grades in the complete value chain covering activities of producers, traders and refiners, leveraging on existing in-house database. Qualifications Good degree in analytical or technical disciplines. Excellent written/ verbal communication and presentation skills. Meticulous, persistent with a sense of curiosity. Able to work in a team as well as independently. Good time management skills and able to meet deadlines. Experiences in market or trade flow analysis will be an advantage. Additional Information Personal Characteristics Creativity and problem solving. Analytical mindset. Results oriented and demonstrably commercial. Incisive and accurate judgment. Excellent attention to detail. Outstanding communication and relationship management skills. Global outlook. Able to work across organizational and cultural boundaries. Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of personal integrity. Energetic, resilient and resourceful, with an ability to work accurately under pressure. Only successful candidates will be notified. Vitol Asia is committed to providing equal opportunities to all staff. Globally, Vitol seeks to conduct its business in accordance with the UN Global Compact’s ten principles, including those on human rights, one of which is to “Ensure a diverse and inclusive work place, where possible, free from discrimination regardless of age, gender, race, cultural heritage, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion or disability.”

MerkleB2B Owned by Merkle and part of the Dentsu Group, Merkle B2B is a joined up offering from 5 specialist agencies, which already manages more than $16bn in global billings, has offices in 5 continents with incredible expertise in integrated, data-driven, tech-enabled solutions. This is an exciting time to join, with global clients such as Intel, Amazon Web Services and Standard Chartered and regional clients like 3M and Salesforce, Merkle B2B is leading the way to integrate a connected customer experience. Overall Responsibilities Reporting to the Finance Manager, you will be responsible to deliver timely and consistent accounting, financial operational support to the business. The key role for the Accounts Executive is to assist and manage the AP and AR function of Singapore. You will play an integral role in providing overall support to the Merkle B2B Finance Team. You will be commercially focused, have hands on experience with a comprehensive ERP system, enjoy building relationships, have strong problem solving and communication skills. The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment is also important. Candidate will be allowed to display their initiative and a pragmatic approach to work. This is a great opportunity to join a friendly team and grow your career. If it sounds like you, don’t hesitate to apply. This role is a maternity cover, for a fixed term until May 2022. Qualifications: Bachelor degree / Diploma, partial professional qualification (CPA/ACCA equiv.) About Castlery Castlery was founded with one mission in mind: to make designer furniture accessible to everyone. By working directly with designers and manufacturers, we create inspirational and high-quality products for our customers without high street price point. As an e-commerce and retail startup, we move decisively based on good data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that's as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. What You'll Be Doing Lead the design of Castlery's global supply chain network, including demand forecasting, inventory positioning, facility design/ roadmap, transportation optimisation, and international trade consideration. Develop and maintain high-quality prediction, simulation and optimisation models for both longer term network design and day-to-day decision execution. Work closely with internal teams and external resources to capture suitable design parameters, constraints, and objectives for statistical models. Lead cross-functional initiatives to ensure customer experience and financial goals are met. Improve supply chain team efficiency by implementing suitable processes and systems. Research industry trends and bring in best practices to the team. Be the Go-To expert and drive optimisation culture in Castlery. What You'll Need Bachelor's degree in Engineering, System Design, Mathematics, Information Systems or other equivalent degrees with outstanding academic achievements. Proven track records working as Supply Chain Engineer/ Analyst, Industrial Engineer, Data Scientist, Modelling Expert or equivalent. Strong command of SQL, Python and associated modelling and data science libraries. Passion and curiosity for modelling and solving challenging problems by leveraging on the right technology. Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-cultural team environment and lead changes. Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization. Ability to deliver sophisticated ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English. The Perks Awesome co-workers Global business and operations exposure Dynamic environment that offers wealth of learning opportunities and room to make an impact Remuneration: Negotiable Location: Based in Singapore

This position is for the SG United Traineeship and will involve doing casework, counselling, and groupwork for youths aged 12-25 struggling with mental health issues. The position reports to the Executive Director and will need to undergo regular supervision sessions as part of training for eventual responsibilities and promotion to Caseworker 1B and higher. During the traineeship, caseworker will handle case management of clients, and be involved in the counselling process. Caseworker will also be involved in community work as well as public education campaigns. Limitless is committed to empowering our staff and interns to learn, grow, and excel in their areas of strength and interest. To provide ground breaking and oftentimes lifesaving services to youths who are struggling. -------- Requirements: - Must possess at least a degree or graduate diploma in Social Work or a Masters in Counselling or equivalent - Fresh Social Workers or Counsellors are welcome to apply - Trained in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, or equivalent - Preferably trained in some form of Trauma Therapy (eg. TF-CBT, EMDR...etc) - Preferably trained or having experience with crisis management and suicide assessment - Able to work with young people struggling with mental health issues Core Competencies: - Fluent in English, and conversant in a second language - Motivated and willing to learn - Has a strong desire and passion to reach out to young people who may be struggling -------- As this is for an SG United Traineeship the position will be a 6 month long contract with the option for full time employment after. Allowance is set at $2500 per month without CPF for Fresh Graduates, and up to $3000 for mid-career individuals

Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia. As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark. If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us! Job Responsibilities Our Finance Team, headquartered here in Singapore, is in charge of maintaining and ensuring all Accounting and Finance operations are running smoothly. You will be part of a specialised and fast-paced managing Castlery's Finances across Singapore, Australia and the United States, and you'll also be given an opportunity to work on various projects, which include system implementation and process improvement. Your daily job responsibilities are as per below. Manage the invoices posting and routing for approval. Ensure that all invoices received have proper contracts in place. Review the trade invoices and make sure all supporting documents are fully attached. Prepare weekly payments and manage the trade financing line Prepare bank reconciliations. In-charge of the intercompany transactions and billing. Prepare and maintenance of the relevant schedules and AP ageing. Liaise with external auditors and support audit activities. Support any other Adhoc projects. Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia. As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark. If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us! Job Summary Castlery is looking for an experienced Branding Programme Manager to join the team. Reporting to Head of Branding, the Branding Programme Manager will facilitate the branding strategy definition and execution for Castlery's global business through large-scale cross-functional programmes. This involves devising and refining medium-term to long-term branding strategies, translating such strategies to properly structured programmes, driving the planning and coordinated execution of relevant programmes across functions and countries, and measuring the effectiveness. Responsibilities Facilitate the formulation and adaptation of our medium-term to long-term branding strategies as we grow rapidly and as the competitive landscape changes. Translates the branding strategies into clear brand programmes across internal teams to ensure the Castlery brand is being represented to the fullest extent while meeting individual team business goals Define and measure effectiveness of the branding programmes and keep on validating and improving the impact. Break down the branding programmes into projects and work with the functional teams to craft clear project plans that are synchronized, properly resourced, and impactful to our strategic goals. Build cross-functional processes, oversee and assist functional teams in their branding project execution, and regularly dive into specific areas of concerns / weaknesses and come up with new initiatives to address them. Support local sales, marketing, and operations teams in the US, Singapore, and Australia to localize our branding strategies and content. Requirements Bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, or related domains Minimum of 4 - 6 years of experience, from management consulting experience with a focus on branding as management consultant or preferably engagement manager; and branding experience in direct-to-consumer eCommerce companies or manufacturers / retailers eCommerce division. Strong functional knowledge and expertise in branding and good understanding of merchandizing, marketing and customer experiences. Proven experience in managing cross functional initiatives. Have a passion and eagerness for branding with experiences in formulating and crafting branding strategies and driving programme planning and execution. Ability to influence and work with a wide range of stakeholders, including merchandizing, marketing, operations, customer experience, and external partners to deliver high-impact cross functional branding projects and processes. Ability to come up with, track, and test hypothesis around the effectiveness of branding initiatives. Nice to Have MBA or advanced degree in marketing, business administration, or related domains

Hiring_Company: Vanguard International Semiconductor Singapore Pte. Ltd.
Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose: Sustain and improve process / SPC to meet quality, cost, productivity requirements Job Descriptions: Analyze SPC charts using SPACE. Know all the PR rules and their significance. Do proper annotation to maintain quality troubleshooting rate for SPC OOC. Understand Cp and Cpk indices. Monitor critical SPC charts daily. Perform process window study and provide improvement plan to reduce OOC and improve CPK Review ESPC charts using SPACE. Know all the rules for ESPC Analyze split lot, DOE data, ET, sort yield using JMP, Klarity ACE Create SPC charts, DCOP and modify SLDB using PROMIS (CAMSTAR) Upload recipe, check recipe and ensure recipe content compliance using RMS Raise PCRB and understands the requirements for PCRB opening, follow through with qual plan, analyze data using required software and CR closure Follow up on SPSR, MRB, 8D, TECN, or spec update with ECN Setup and troubleshoot issues in recipes/job files in all metrology tools within the Module. Do regular housekeeping of production job files Follow up on pass down to troubleshoot process issues. Establish CAS / procedures to be followed and work with other departments for resolution if required Startup and qualify new process and new equipment within scheduled timeline. Work closely with Equipment Engineer on new equipment acceptance. Know the concept of repeatability and reproducibility (R&R) run Work on reducing process constraints so that Mfg can have more flexibility Perform process matching between equipment to reduce variation and analysis / DOE to find factors for better tool matching Participate in CIP programs to optimize process window, cost, yield, and productivity Work as a team with both Equipment and Mfg Engineers to meet Module objectives. Work to meet the key indices of Uptime and OEE goals Represent own Module to attend cross-functional task team to address yield improvement / excursion issues. Follow up with cross-fab benchmarking activities to engage the best-in-campus practices across fabs Follow good housekeeping and safety rules in office and Fab Provide feedback/training to AEs or Techs on their troubleshooting skills, understanding of processes, decision making, risk assessment Provide monthly report to Supervisor Participate in wafer scrap reduction. Ensure no human error Responsible and accountable for complying with and implementing environmental, health, safety and security (EHSS) system, policies, procedures and guidelines that are applicable to your scope of work, thereby maintaining a healthy and safe workspace Requirements: Diploma or Degree in Electrical / Electronics /Microelectronics / Chemical Process Engineering / Chemistry / Physics related major Diploma holders min 5 years working experience in Semiconductor Front-End Process

About Us IHG Hotels & Resorts' first voco™ hotel in South East Asia is now open on Singapore’s world-famous Orchard Road! voco® Orchard Singapore provides guests with the world-renowned voco™ experience from the moment they walk through its doors. Famed to be hotels to count on, yet different enough to be fun, voco hotels are unstuffy hotels where people feel comfortable to relax, and just get on with life. Hotels that stand out from the crowd, voco combines familiar comforts with the indulgences of a hotel, to create somewhere that’s dependable, but not vanilla. Somewhere premium, but with a laidback spirit. Somewhere reliable, but different. Your day to day voco Orchard Singapore is seeking a purchasing officer to join its team. As Purchasing Officer you’ll coordinate or assist in the purchasing, receiving, storage, and/or dispensing of food and/or non-food items to meet the needs of the various departments and functions. Assist Purchasing Manager with the purchasing of all goods and equipment required by the hotel Obtain competitive quotations for hotel requirements and ensure that the best product is sourced and purchased, using group nominated suppliers where applicable Ensure the purchase of correct goods and materials at a competitive price and proper quantities/ volumes Ensure locally nominated supplier information is kept current Monitor all areas of purchasing including contracts, leases and nominations Ensure a comprehensive system for allocating and reconciling purchase orders Other ad-hoc duties – unexpected moments when we have to pull together to get a task done Prepare the month end accounts reports in an accurate and timely manner Maintain a record of commitments for all budgets and ensure that the relevant senior managers are constantly informed of updates Maintain Purchase Plus database in an organized manner Maintain supplier product data including catalogue content, product specifications, photographs, descriptions and pricing and keep them confidential What we need from you At least diploma or equivalent in related discipline Two years hotel procurement with knowledge of purchasing and supply chain management of food, beverage, operating supplies, FF&E and contracted services or an equivalent combination of education and experience Must be proficient in MS Office. Proficiency in procurement software such as MarketBoomer/Purchase Plus is an advantage Must speak fluent English What we offer We’ll reward all your hard work with a great salary and benefits – great room discount and superb training. Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care: that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - visit www.http://careers.ihg.com to find out more about us. IHG is an equal opportunity employer: Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veterans. Hotel Brand: voco Location: Singapore, Central Singapore, Singapore Job number: EMEAA29413

Hiring_Company: Hilton International Asia Pacific Pte Ltd
Job_Title: Senior Director, Enterprise, Brand & Owned Channels - Asia Pacific
Job_Descriptions: With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others. If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it's with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike. The Enterprise, Brand & Owned Channels team brings to life the unique customer promise of the Hilton master brand and the key value proposition of Hilton's portfolio of brands by defining, creating, and delivering exceptional multi-channel integrated marketing campaigns and customer experience designed to drive business results. Within the Enterprise, Brand & Owned Channels, you will lead initiatives that span across Hilton's portfolio of brands including driving direct and deeper relationships with consumers, defining the Hilton Customer Promise and retaining & engaging customers through our owned channels including eCommerce, Social and CRM. Reporting to the Vice President of Marketing & Loyalty - APAC, you will be the voice of APAC in the global development and steer key marketing initiatives across Enterprise & Brand Marketing, working with the relevant product and digital team to ensure that critical regional market nuisances / needs are captured and addressed upstream. Through a deep understanding of consumer insights and business results, you will contribute to developing and refining our Hilton master brand customer promise, marketing strategy and integrated marketing plans for APAC across Enterprise & Brand initiatives. Additionally, you will partner with other Marketing and Loyalty teams within the region build Omni Channel marketing strategies from creative development and execution to media planning and social media. These strategies will not only drive revenue and market share, but also build brand love and loyalty among existing guests and cultivate and engage new customer segments. You will be responsible for building out our owned channel strategy and plan working in conjunction with our global team to build capabilities needed for the region. Are you ready to join the team responsible for leading the marketing strategy for our iconic and award-winning brands What will I be doing As the Senior Director, Enterprise, Brand & Owned Channels - APAC, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: Work with the Global Enterprise & Brand Marketing team to contribute to the global Masterbrand customer promise, develop purpose-driven campaign for APAC including marketing planning activities and campaign execution, in conjunction with media planning and PR, and create a high-impact website presence that drives conversion, all in service of driving business results and brand love. Develop a multiyear roadmap to ensure we have the right capabilities to engage with our consumer and Honors members via CRM, Social and eCommerce channels, working closely with our global and local product, technology and analytics teams. Work with the APAC leadership team in-region to understand and address commercial performance goals for the business. Identify core research, analytics, and metrics to inform consumer insights, drive efficiency of marketing executions, and develop strong, engaging creative. Manage creative agencies of record to ensure positive relationships and facilitate groundbreaking, world-class work. Partner with our Media Strategy & Planning team and media agency of record to plan and implement media strategies within APAC to achieve brand goals. Monitor success and opportunities for improvement in a test-and-learn environment to improve return on investment. Develop partnerships in region that are linked to global strategies to build relationships with third parties and reach new audiences, working with APAC Media & Partnership team partners. Empower a growing portfolio of hotels to market themselves locally by developing centrally managed resources. Collaborate with key partners, and actively manage stakeholders up, down, and diagonally across the enterprise, with a focus on Owners, Regional Leadership, Category and Global Brand Heads, and Brand Performance Support. Recruit and nurture top talent and foster a high performing environment that builds a performance-driven, dynamic, highly engaged team. What are we looking for A Senior Director, Enterprise, Brand & Owned Channels - APAC serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: BA / BS Bachelor's Degree in Marketing / Communications or related field. Significant experience in corporate marketing or advertising agency roles. People management experience. Experience with omni-channel integrated marketing within the APAC region. Passionate about leveraging consumer insights to power marketing impact and innovation. Accomplished in building positive relationships across a matrixed organization. Strong ability to collaborate while persuasively selling-in ideas that are not always immediately intuitive. Confidently communicate ideas to senior executive and owner audiences. 20% travel time both domestically / in-region and internationally; must have, or be able to obtain, all necessary documents to travel internationally as needed. It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: MBA in Marketing or related field. Extensive experience in corporate marketing or advertising agency roles. Significant people management experience. Hospitality experience. Multi-lingual (Asian language such as Mandarin or Japanese). Knowledge of franchise organizations. What will it be like to work for Hilton Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Job Objectives/Job Summary: To manage and optimize operations in the waste management industry. The Operations Executive is responsible for assisting the management with the daily operations. He/She consolidates relevant data and trends to conduct environmental impact assessments and improvise work processes. He also evaluates reported mechanical faults to rectify issues. In performing most of these functions, he recommends and facilitates the implementation and maintenance schedules of equipment and manages incidents related to waste disposal operations. He/She works in a waste management and oversees the handling and disposal operations while ensuring that all activities are completed in a safe and efficient way. He is constantly exposed to unpleasant sights and smells. He also manages team and incidents relating to operations and vehicle/equipment cleanliness and serviceability and communicates with relevant stakeholders and clients. He is organised, responsive, approachable, able to multi-task and capable of interacting with stakeholders. Responsibilities/Duties: Manage waste operations Ensure team achieved the given objectives are achieved and prevent contamination to the environment Ensure team adheres to safety measures during waste operations Coordinate with appropriate persons to ensure complies with the organisational requirements Gather relevant data to conduct environmental impact assessments Research and report on existing and emerging trends in waste managements Implement methods and standard operating procedures for waste disposal operations Implement operation plans to improve and track work processes in compliance with organisational requirements Manage inventory, equipment and maintenance schedule Evaluate reported mechanical faults and inform the appropriate persons Identify and recommend suitable equipment and/or technologies to improve waste disposal operations Report on inspected equipment and/or facilities to ensure optimal functioning Implement suitable equipment and/or technologies in waste disposal Implement and/or initiate maintenance schedules of all appropriate tools and equipment Manage teams Facilitate the planning of work schedules and deployment of manpower Facilitate effective work processes Facilitate the capability development of staff Manage incidents Attend to enquiries from clients and teams Guide the team to respond to major incidents and emergencies Assist in providing updates on major incidents and emergencies to the appropriate person Any other ad-hoc Job Specifications/Requirements: a) Qualifications Diploma b) Experience Preferably 3 years experience in waste/recycling management or related fields. c) Skills & Knowledge Must have good written and verbal communication skills in both English and Mandarin in order to liaise with Chinese speaking associates. Must be competent in basic IT skills such as Office and Email. Must be able to embrace new technology with the aim of efficiency. d) Personal Qualities Adaptability, professionalism and, positive attitude and show willingness to learn.

The Role We are seeking an experience support engineer to join our Platform Support Engineering team in Singapore. The candidate will be a part of a team that provides front line support for our proprietary quantitative trading platform. The team provide follow the sun support (alongside counterparts based in UK and US) provide 24/7 monitoring and support for Schonfeld's trading environment as well as closely working with the development teams to ensure reliability, maintainability and performance of the production environment. What you'll do The Platform Support Engineer will serve as the first point of contact for production issues, support requests and alerts. You will investigate and solve issues/outages as they occur and escalate as necessary. The Engineer will collaborate with software development teams to ensure successful deployment of new code into production. The ideal candidate will also automate processes and workflows as well as build tooling for our environment. What you'll bring What you need: At minimum, five years of experience in financial services supporting trading and post-trade systems Experience in managing large scale deployments/environments Experience supporting applications in a Linux environment Strong scripting skills Python, Bash, Shell, Perl Experience developing tools and/or automating processes Experience with supporting FIX protocol An understanding of monitoring, and performance management Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong ownership experience and a track record of delivering results A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field We'd love if you had: Experience performing FIX certification/onboarding Experience with NFS and GPFS file systems Knowledge of storage devices Experience with application monitoring systems such as ITRS Geneos Experience with Control-M job scheduling Knowledge of q and kdb+ Experience with AWS Experience with Docker Our culture The firm's ethos is embedded in our people. Talent is our strategy is our mantra and drives how we approach all initiatives at the firm. We believe our success is because of our people, so putting our talent above all else is our top priority. Schonfeld strives to create an environment where our people can thrive. We foster a teamwork-oriented, collaborative environment where ideas at any level are encouraged and shared. The development and advancement of our talent is honed through interactions with each other, learning & educational offerings, and through opportunities to make impactful contributions. In our agile environment, engineers are expected to self-organize and collaborate on the best way to solve problems, and they are collectively responsible for the entire team's delivery. Engineering teams are small and cross-functional, and value learning and knowledge sharing. At Schonfeld, we strive to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout all of our employees with Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at the forefront of this mission. As a firm we are committed to creating a hiring process which is not only fair, but also welcoming and supportive. On a daily basis, our employees welcome diversity across identity, thought, people and views which serves as the foundation of our culture and success. You can learn more about our D&I initiatives here - Belonging @ Schonfeld. Who we are Schonfeld Strategic Advisors is a multi-manager platform that invests its capital with Internal and Partner portfolio managers, primarily on an exclusive or semi-exclusive basis, across quantitative, fundamental equity and tactical trading strategies. We have created a unique structure to provide global portfolio managers with autonomy, flexibility and support to best enable them to maximize the value of their businesses. Over the last 30 years, Schonfeld has successfully capitalized on inefficiencies and opportunities within the equity markets. We have developed and invested heavily in proprietary technology, infrastructure and risk analytics. Our portfolio exposure has expanded across the Americas, Europe and Asia as well as multiple asset classes and products.

Job_Title: Customer Engineer, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems. The role: Customer Engineer, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud - Singapore The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. Additional Role Description: As a Customer Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks. You will also be part of a diverse team of fellow Googlers working in an environment of respect and inclusion where we promote equal opportunities to succeed. Responsibilities: - Challenge and inspire customers and peers to solve difficult problems with novel solutions, leveraging a sophisticated set of technical competences. - Manage the go-to-market strategy from technical perspective. Craft the strategy to transform the customers, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers. - Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments. Help the Account team to close agreements from technical perspective. - Recommend migration strategies, enterprise architectures, migration tools, and cloud infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud. - Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. - Experience planning infrastructure modernization as a technical consultant, technical pre-sales engineer, or enterprise architect. - Experience in one of the following: cloud migration, data-center migration, disaster recovery, virtualization, application/servers assessment and discovery. - Experience leading IT strategy discussion and design cloud adoption plans. Preferred qualifications: - Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field. - Experience helping customers design and build applications using open source or cloud-native databases. - Experience with developing scalable architectures using API management, microservice frameworks (i.e. Spring Cloud, Istio), container orchestration systems (i.e. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Docker), networking concepts including: routing, VPNs, load balancers, and firewalls. - Experience with deployment methodologies and technologies (e.g., CI/CD, Chef, Puppet, Ansible). - Knowledge of VMware technology stack (e.g., vSphere, vCenter, ESXi, vSAN, etc.).

Background Charles Taylor is a global provider of professional services and technology solutions dedicated to enabling the global insurance market to do its business fundamentally better. Dating back to 1884, Charles Taylor now is currently in more than 120 locations spread across 30 countries in Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific, the Middle East and Africa. Charles Taylor believes that it holds a distinctive position in its markets in that it is able to provide professional services and technology solutions in order to support every stage of the insurance lifecycle and every aspect of the insurance operating model. Charles Taylor serves a diversified blue-chip international customer base that includes national and international insurance companies, mutuals, captives, MGAs, Lloyd's syndicates and reinsurers, along with brokers, distributors and corporate insureds. For more information, please visit www.charlestaylor.com The Role You will be accompanied by senior staff to: Attend loss site (onshore / offshore) for survey / damage assessment Attend kick-off and subsequent meetings with Insured to discuss details of the loss The foregoing will require periodic travel within Asia and safety training will be provided by CTA for onshore / offshore attendance as required Assist senior staff with engineering analysis of technical reports / design specifications & drawings etc. as part of cause analysis and damage assessment Review documentation and discussions with the Insured relating to cause of damage, extent of damage and scope of repair. Job Description and Requirements Alpha & Omega Law Corporation and its related consulting company (Firm) is looking for a full-time Administrator to undertake the day-to-day operations to achieve good corporate governance of the Firm, ensure a clean, pleasant, happy and comfortable environment for all staff and visitors to its office premises and contribute substantially to delivering excellent client service. Responsibilities include: (a) Support the day-to-day operations of the Firm (daily); (b) Schedule, organise and coordinate internal and external meetings/conference, courses and other events; (c) Maintain training record for Continuing Legal Education points of the legal team; (d) Maintain proper filing of manual and electronic documents (daily); (e) Daily checking, retrieving and processing of correspondences (including e-correspondences received from Courts and government bodies) (daily); (f) Supporting team by systematically reminding when email responses have not met the internal timelines of the Firm (daily); (g) Data entry to maintain up-to-date records of incoming and outgoing payments and other accounts/banking transactions; (h) Online banking matters including physical attendance at banks relating to the Firm's bank accounts; (i) Mailing of letters; (j) Maintain pantry and stationery stock/inventory; (k) Maintain legal books inventory; (l) Manage all IT hardware and software and simple troubleshooting. Job_Descriptions: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 18,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships. . Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 68 markets with more than 193,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region. BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you're valued as part of the team. * excluding partnerships https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/ Position Purpose APAC Production Security teams (based in Singapore and India) is covering multiple IT Security challenging tasks for BNP Paribas Asia Pacific region, such as: - Production CSIRT / Logging & Detection - Network Security - Vulnerability & Compliance Security scanning - Privileged Identity Management - Designing & Implementation of Security solutions - Production Support of Security solutions As a member of the APAC Production Security Incident Response Team (APAC PCSIRT), you will be part of a 24/7 team providing monitoring and incident response services for the whole Asia-Pacific region. As a senior technical member, you will participate in the different activities of incident response, as well as Threat Hunting activities within our scope. Your advanced analysis of the cases, and your technical background will help to improve the detection capabilities of the team and to react more accurately. You will also participate in many different activities to improve the efficiency and the quality of the incident response within the Bank : - participate as a Blue Team to security incident response and handle purple team exercises - strengthen the governance and improve the team efficiency by using automation - participate to the improvement of the detection capabilities by developing new use cases - reinforce the skills of the team on L2/L3 and threat hunting topics In particular, the new joiner will work closely with APAC CSIRT and Threat Intelligence teams. Finally, the new joiner will fully be part of the Production CSIRT / Logging & Detection team and will have the opportunity to expand the scope of activities within the team. Responsibilities Direct Responsibilities ? Gap Analysis on the Incident Respond Process compared to best practices ? Participate on the Incident Response mechanism and the development of new use cases in partnership with Logging And Detection Team ? Respond on Security Incident and provide accurate and efficient response ? Actively work on Threat Hunting methodologies, tools deployment and activities within and across BNP Paribas APAC, in close collaboration with Production and APAC CSIRT/CTI teams ? Identify and track advanced threats within the IT Production (being part of an exercise or not) ? Be a full time member of the Production CSIRT / Logging & Detection team and participate to the various activities of the team Contributing Responsibilities ? Contribute to the Permanent Control framework for implementation of policies and procedures in day?to?day business activities, such as Control Plan. ? Comply with regulatory requirements and internal guidelines. ? Contribute to the reporting of all incidents according to the Incident Management System ? Enhancement and definition of the Incident Response framework within the Bank Qualifications Technical and Behavioral Competencies / Specific Qualifications (if required) 8-10 years of experience in the IT Security field with at least 4 years of experience on Threat Hunting or Incident response as L2/L3 member Independent, self-motivated and innovative with good problem solving, interpersonal and communication skills, and can foster teamwork, coaching and mentoring of other team members Strong understanding of cyber threat analysis models such as kill chain, diamond model, etc and how they apply to both targeted and non-targeted threats Experience in common scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, LUA, PowerShell or BASH Experience on Operating Systems (Windows, UNIX) Experience with Log Analysis from multiple sources Experience with creation and fine-tuning of alerting rules from different systems (SIEM Usecases/EDR) Strong understanding of common security products and technologies utilized in Enterprise environments (proxies, WAF, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Anti-Malware, Endpoint, etc) Understanding of the OSI stack and the various protocols from layer 1 to 7 including SNMP, HTTP, VPN, DNS, etc. Qualification University degree or equivalent in IT discipline (preferably in IT Security) Professional credentials in one of the relevant IT Security disciplines SANS / OSCP / OSCE Certification is a plus

JOB SUMMARY Responsible for the assigned customer account, to ensure all product quality, process quality and system quality to conform with customers specifications and internal quality system requirements. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Key contact point, for assigned customer account, to liaise with Customer Quality representatives on all Quality matters. Prepare monthly and/or quarterly Customer Quality Presentations Lead the investigation on all Customer Quality Feedback, Complaints, RMA FA and CAR with internal cross-functional team for comprehensive root cause failure analysis and ensure closure with effective implementation of corrective actions and preventive actions. Monitor product quality performance and generate quality reports; chair internal weekly or bi-weekly product quality improvement meetings to reduce the customer reject and field return rate for continual improvement; Identify Quality Improvement projects and initiatives to drive Customer Satisfaction with Quality. Chair MRB meetings for disposition of MRR's for production line fallout for non-conforming materials/ products; conduct first level analysis with ME on Production Material Line Fallout, before requesting Supplier Quality Engineer for vendors failure analysis and actions for relevant cases. Establish with customer representative and internal team on New Product Quality plans, procedures, work instruction for overall quality control and coordinate implementation and maintenance of such plans, procedures or instructions; conduct quality training/ cross training for QA inspectors. Audit customer product line for compliance to applicable standards and procedures in QMS and EMS Authority: Approve relevant quality-related documents; e.g. manufacturing instructions, checklist, inspection plan Approve relevant inspection results; e.g. calibration records, inspection records, test records Activate stop production and/or shipment in the event of product non conformity until issue is resolved for resumption Reject material/process/products that fail QA/customer inspections/tests Activate purge and recall non-conforming finished goods, if necessary. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Minimum Diploma or Degree in Electronics/ Electrical/ Mechanical Degree holders with more than 3 yrs working experience as QA in electronic manufacturing environment or Diploma holders with more than 5 yrs similar working experience will also be considered. Experience in Medical Devices manufacturing processes will be an advantage Basic knowledge of ISO 9001, ISO13485, ISO14001, FDA 21 CFR Part 820 & Part 11 Quality System Requirements will be an advantage JOB-RELATED SKILLS Basic knowledge on Microsoft Office, FMEA, Control Plan, Quality Plan, QC Seven Tools, CAPA Methodology (ie. using 8D, 5-whys, Fish-bone, etc) and Statistical Techniques. Able to interpret basic technical drawing, component datasheet, schematic diagram, inspection checklist and sampling plan table. Able to use basic QC measuring equipment.

Want to help a mouse reach and make friends with thousands of humans? We’ve got an opening! Sqkii is known for our #HuntTheMouse and #HuntFromHome campaigns that give away cold, hard cash to players. In the good old pre-COVID days, our hunts and custom games got Singaporeans squatting in random spots and running after golden eggs. For now, we’re bringing players on virtual adventures through their mobile screens — they’re still super cool, just ask the mouse. We paid a virtual visit to the player community in Malaysia in 2020 with #HuntFromHome — Around The World, and oh boy do we have big plans ahead for SEA and beyond. Big plans = lots more humans coming up, so we’re on the hunt for someone who loves other humans to hop aboard this journey with us. As our Community Manager Intern, you’ll be trusted with growing and knowing the mouse’s human friends, i.e. Sqkii’s player community (we also call most of them hunters). We’re looking for someone who’s excited to talk to other humans and genuinely wants to hear them out, so that we can build even better games for everyone to enjoy. On that note, you might even find yourself playing or hosting a game or two; we’re open to any and all ideas, so if you’re convinced that having a mini-game with our hunters will liven things up, well, why not? In fact, if you’ve got an idea swimming around now... Our Operations team is more than ready to meet you. Your move. P.S. After you’ve applied, we’ll send over some secret tasks for you to try your hand at before we arrange for a virtual chat! What you’ll be doing: Defining and developing a community management strategy Monitoring and optimising community engagement levels Driving growth of Sqkii’s existing playtester base Conceptualising and organising community-building initiatives to cultivate player participation in community forums What you’ll need: A strong understanding of the way online communities function and typical rules, cultures, and environments of such communities Strong interpersonal skills and the desire and ability to build genuine relationships Familiarity with social media platforms and their communities, including Telegram, Discord, and Facebook High empathy and a people-oriented mindset

The Network Operations Engineer is responsible for efficiently operating and maintaining IB's production and development infrastructure in alignment with the enterprise strategies and standards. The candidate is responsible for supporting the deployment of network solutions with adherence to IB's technical standards. The successful candidate will have deep technical experience within WAN, LAN, Voice and Security technologies, including a demonstrated background in Routing Protocols, Contact Center & Network Security Platforms. The candidate must also have broad proficiency in Network Virtualization, Cloud computing, SDN/NFV and overlay technologies. The candidate must be able to handle multiple priorities and translate conceptual designs into executable technology solutions. In this role, the candidate will be accountable for fulfilling day to day business requirements with an aim towards automated fault management and documenting network designs and ensuring communication and delivery of these services globally. Key Responsibilities Perform troubleshooting of system failures and identify bottlenecks to ensure long term efficiency of the global network. Diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and other network and system related problems Manages and fine tunes network monitoring and capacity management applications to reduce noise and deliver meaningful insights Develops release management plan for platform connectivity solutions. Analyzes vulnerabilities, bugs and target features to recommend future OS versions. Provides cost justification for implementation across IB's environment Work in collaboration with the design team to facilitate configuration and management of IB's production networks Assist with maintaining business critical services in Contact Center environments for better availability, reliability and cost efficiency. Consult with peer organizations on best practices and technical guidance on all manner of Merger, Acquisition and Divestiture projects Mentor junior staff in network helpdesk, including involvement in the formulation of a structured training plan Communicate the progress of your work to your peers, customers, and leads Provide self-assessment on how to improve their own performance Contribute towards streamlining functional processes and help minimize resource inefficiency Qualification Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering 5-7 years of direct experience installing and /or managing a highly available global production network for a large enterprise with at least 2 years of current hands on experience with data center and branch routing, switching, voice and security 3+ years of demonstrated experience in a large enterprise with a focus on reliable connectivity in, contact center and unified communications for financial and regulated environments 2+ years of tooling and analytics experience supporting monitoring, root cause analysis and automation. Relevant work experience, including Unix systems administration with scripting experience in Shell, Ansible, Python or PERL Current knowledge and demonstrated understanding of infrastructure protocols (BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, ECMP, etc.), Route optimization, load balancing, Multicast, 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, IPsec, RADIUS/TACACS+, IPAM and application protocols (HTTP/S, TCP/UDP, LDAP, SNMP, etc.) as well as means of securing communications Versed in a variety of hardware and software manufacturers, and a high degree of comfort and experience in mixed vendor environments e.g. Cisco, Arista, Juniper, VMWare, F5 as well as developing and deploying solutions on open source protocols and technologies Hands on knowledge of wired and wireless connectivity platforms and protocols such as DWDM, MPLS, Spanning-tree, RF optimization, 802.11x and 802.1x authentication Expert knowledge and experience with Internet Protocol (IP) suite is essential, including protocols such as SIP, H.323, MGCP and their relationships and integrations in large-scale networks Must have general and technical knowledge of telecommunications technologies (as it relates to VoIP) including: TCP-IP, IP routing, Voice packet capture, VOIP, PBXTDM, inter-working of these technologies as it relates to voice, data, broadband, IPT, and Internet services, deployment and implementation of these technologies and services Will be responsible for implementation, configuration, troubleshooting, daily operation and upgrading of core Avaya Aura Products including System Manager, Session Manager, Communications Manager, Media Server, Voice Gateways G450/G430/G650, Application Enablement (AES), CC Elite, SIP trunking, SIP endpoints Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Good communication and interpersonal skills

The team is rapidly expanding its Singapore office and is therefore looking for a self-driven, highly motivated, pro-active candidate to join the Singapore team in October/November 2021. Job_Title: BILLING EXECUTIVE, REGISTRY SERVICES (2-year contract position)
Location: Supreme Court Lane, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179803, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
