Job_Title: Director, Commercial Planning and Governance - Asia Pacific
Job_Descriptions: Description With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others. If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike. The Director, Commercial Planning and Governance - Asia Pacific (APAC) will work directly with the Vice President of Revenue Management and Commercial Services - APAC, responsible to manage and govern (where applicable) programs, projects, and have business oversight responsibility on behalf of the APAC Commercial Services Organization. These will include developing and maintaining solutions, business processes, standards, procedures, and best practices. The Director, Commercial Planning & Governance - APAC will lead and be responsible for managing key relationships both internally / externally through planning cycles, cadence and governance. The Director will communicate at a Senior leadership level of the Commercial Services organization including all direct reports of the Senior Vice President & Commercial Director - APAC. This position will help facilitate priority regional team meetings and own its cadence to drive discussion, decision, and alignment. This position will manage and support the annual process of identification of Commercial priorities, tracking and completion thereof. This role will play a key role in steering and co-leading the company’s planning and governance processes in close liaison with peer colleagues in other parts of the business and regions. This is a central position to go to with cross-collaborative reach. The Director, Commercial Planning and Governance - APAC will additionally oversee the leadership and governance of Sales Performance for APAC, ensuring our program in APAC is fit for purpose. What will I be doing? As the Director, Commercial Planning & Governance - APAC, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standard: Management / leadership of specific APAC Commercial Services Programs and Projects. Leading the co-ordination of yearly commercial program planning on behalf of the region. Management of business related workstreams within wider commercial services projects. Partner with Global Commercial Services Leadership groups to effectively develop project plans and represent the needs for APAC, supporting Global Commercial Services initiatives. Oversee successful implementation of new projects, maintenance and support of product enhancements with Commercial Services partners. Ensure that the APAC Commercial Services unit remains in control of its execution and is anticipating when we’re deviating (for better or worse) from plan and drives actions from this as a result. Proactively comes with proposals to the Leadership Team to course-correct our execution when off-plan. Governance and oversight to internal / external vendors (technology, process, project). Although the position does not have any Direct Reports, as a Project Manager, you will need to manage stakeholders at all levels and on multiple project workstreams. Lead the Senior Manager, Sales Performance Management - APAC to ensure the Sales Incentive Program for APAC is fit for purpose and relevant to needs. Lead SPM discussions on a global level and incorporate feedback from the APAC Leaders. Planning and Governance Commercial Plan: PMO for APAC key initiatives and tactics. Commercial Strategic Blueprints: Formulation and implementation of the APAC commercial strategic roadmap. Commercial Services Integration Franchise: Define Commercial Services Franchise support by function mirroring O&M. BPS: Launch Gen for Commercial Services implementation and advocacy. Working relationships: Establish framework between Commercial, Development, Operations and Owners. Value Proposition: Develop and launch Commercial Services Value Proposition. Sales Performance Management Restart SIP: Relaunch SIP for all hotels. SCOUT: Renew operating method to advance cross-pollination. Continuous auditing: Be relentless about operationality and finding efficiencies driving global improvement. Non-monetary programs: Explore option to further engage Sales TMs. Commercial Events Re-launch: Establish a commercial events calendar in line with performance cadence. Build a cross-functional team to support events production. Awards programs: Align with global Commercial recognition programs and facilitate delivery in region. Requirements What are we looking for? A Director, Commercial Planning and Governance - APAC serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow: Minimum ten (10) years in analytical role. Minimum six (6) years in role requiring regular presentation to executive leadership. Minimum four (4) years managing staff or vendor relationships. Proven years of experience that includes leading a project management team. Experience in running larger cross-department and cross-company (planning) processes with a large organizational reach. Skilled in operational management, including running cross-functional initiatives, financial and business modelling, strategic options identification, consensus building, and implementation. Skilled at change management across an organization, both vertically as well as horizontally. Ability to stay on top of details, deliverables and anticipate and propose solutions to potential roadblocks to keep activities on track. Strong prioritization and decision-making skills with proven ability to manage multiple priorities and projects with deadlines. Ability to work effectively and influence others in a matrixed environment including working within and among teams and influence others at all levels. Strong communication skills. Critical thinking and analytical skills. Advanced Excel modeling, SQL, data retrieval and manipulation. MS Office (including PowerPoint presentation skills). Global Conference call participation (evening or early morning). Leadership Behaviours Proactive enterprise leadership mindset to work across the Commercial Services organization within APAC and Global. Collaborator who will reach out to the business and proactively think through and set up efficient processes to deliver APAC needs. Global interactions with Senior Leadership roles within APAC and Global – confidence to speak and lead discussions. Ability to conceptualize and present thinking for strategic blueprints. ABOUT MONEYTHOR Moneythor is an award-winning enterprise software company based in Singapore providing banks and fintech firms world-wide with a modern technology platform to enhance their digital banking services, with a prime focus on the generation of data-driven personalised recommendations and insights for consumers and businesses. Moneythor is headquartered in Singapore and with presence in London, Paris, Tokyo, Dubai, and further expansion in progress. Our solution is currently used by financial institutions in Asia-Pacific, Japan, Europe, Middle East, and North America. OVERVIEW Do you have a clear sense of how a world-class Technical Account Manager (TAM) ensures client success Do you love the idea of leveraging both your business acumen and your technical skills on a daily basis to deliver on your clients needs Do you believe that there can be no business success without client success If you answered yes to these questions, then this might be the perfect role for you! We're looking for a pro-active, personable, and resourceful Technical Account Manager who is willing to roll up their sleeves and to help us grow both our capabilities and team. You will drive development of our TAM methodology taking on both ownership for the client experience as well as being the client advocate within Moneythor. You will be the point person for our enterprise clients and help them maximise the value they generate from the Moneythor solution. You will also work closely with our business development, product, and engineering teams to identify potential product enhancements and sales opportunities arising from your client engagements. This role is not for the faint-hearted, we are looking for people who love a multi-pronged challenge and want to help ensure that we exceed our clients expectations every day. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide assistance to our digital banking clients and address their ongoing technical & functional questions. Partner with business development, product, and engineering teams in pre-sales, onboarding, and client retention activities. Play an evangelist role with our clients on the existing and/or new features of the solution. Maximize platform adoption/engagement and drive new business growth through greater advocacy and reference-ability. Understand and analyse client business requirements, and help implement, test, package and ensure the timely and accurate solution delivery Maintain in-depth understanding of our platform and provide vetted, impactful customer feedback to the product team Use a case tracking system to manage information, questions and answers for every client-driven request. Identify potential opportunities to extend our relationship with clients and ensure that these are passed on to the appropriate team members. Maintain expert professional knowledge about the market and developments in the digital banking industry. Ensure accurate and timely completion of all projects and requests. REQUIREMENTS Prior experience in a TAM role, or as a customer-facing technical and business analyst with involvement in project implementation, pre-sales and support activities. Hands-on technical experience with enterprise software development stacks as well as JavaScript, HTML, Web and database technologies. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Ability to work on multiple client accounts in autonomy with little or no management oversight. Bachelor or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.

Job_Title: Manager, Brand Food & Beverage Development - Asia Pacific
Job_Descriptions: Description With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others. If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike. The Manager, Brand Food & Beverage Development - Asia Pacific (APAC) is responsible for contributing to and supporting high quality, profitable, and contemporary food & beverage (F&B) development solutions for the Luxury, Lifestyle, and Full-Service brands that aim to exceed guest expectations within our franchised and managed hotels, enhance the value proposition for our brands, and appeal to the local dining clientele within the market. What will I be doing? As the Manager, Brand Food & Beverage Development - APAC, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standard: Assist in the preparation of detailed restaurant and bar concept briefs for review, distribution and presentation to internal and external stakeholders. Contribute to Brand Food & Beverage Development team’s database relating to trends, customer, and market research. Prepare detailed market studies for key locations across the region. Review product and service standards for F&B concepts. Prepare departmental presentations for use as communications and development tools for internal and external stakeholders. Coordinate and track the status of new F&B project development across APAC. Work with key stakeholders within the organization and external vendors to ensure all parties assist and support the restaurant concept and design process. Ensure the continued communication and regular meetings with Brand Management teams, F&B Operations, Hotel Operations, AD&C and other internal stakeholders. Streamline business processes to maximize efficiency and effectiveness within the department. Execute the organization’s mission, goals and objectives. Effective time management in ensuring the delivery of concepts and plans in a timely fashion. Regular discussions with your manager on actual performance against standards to determine whether the department is on target to reach its goals and takes corrective actions as necessary. Requirements What are we looking for? A Manager, Brand Food & Beverage Development - APAC serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow: BA / BS / Bachelor’s degree in Interior Design. 3 to 5 years of significant F&B management related experience. Knowledge of F&B operations, supervisory aspects, service techniques, current F&B trends and concepts. Assist in the conceptual development of tools and resources to assist the team in achieving established goals and culture. Develop programs that share best-demonstrated practices information on cost controls and analysis, as needed, to enhance restaurant concepts' performance and profitability. Proficient in the preparation of PowerPoint presentations. Excellent presentation and public speaking skills, as well as excellent written communication skills. Ability to manage change, resolve conflicts and ensure collaboration within teams and/or units; includes maintaining the highest standards of ethical conduct and integrity. Absolute discretion and confidentiality regarding sensitive information. Strong problem-solving skills, including ability to effectively address any issue in collaboration with others as appropriate; ability to proactively identify and prevent potential problems. Ability to assimilate new concepts and practices into position and provide effective training for on-the-job training, policies and procedures, departmental training topics and professional development. Good working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including ability to understand / manipulate basic spreadsheets. Ability to work independently and manage the independent work of other team members as appropriate; includes the ability to recognize need for involvement of other teams / peers and capability to effectively facilitate that collaboration. It would be helpful in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Culinary or F&B Management degree. 5 to 7 years of significant F&B management / operations related experience. Diverse hospitality industry experience preferred, with a mix of experience in food & beverage roles In-depth knowledge of restaurant concepts, restaurant design, trends and menu planning. Bilingual in English and Mandarin to support APAC market including Greater China & Mongolia. What is it like working for Hilton? Hilton is the world’s leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities, and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Job_Title: Senior Manager, Sales Performance Management - Asia Pacific
Job_Descriptions: Description With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others. If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike. As the Senior Manager, Sales Performance Management - Asia Pacific (APAC), you will contribute to the successful development and drive the local execution of the global Hilton Sales Performance Management framework for the region, to include sales incentive plans and goal setting, in close collaboration with the Global Sales Performance Management team and specifically with the Senior Director, Global Sales Performance Management. You will drive program excellence with oversight and governance responsibilities, optimizing the CRM utilization and relevance to the Sales organization. You will work closely with Analytics and drive reporting needs that will provide actionable sales intelligence. In addition, you will support ad-hoc sales performance support where necessary. What will I be doing? As the Senior Manager, Sales Performance Management - APAC, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standard: Your role will be built on four pillars: Sales Performance Management programs, with vision and a consultative approach. Account Management Excellence, delivering quality and innovation. Reporting and Oversight, through collaboration and leadership. Supportive Mindset, displaying initiative, proactiveness and a commitment to operational excellence. More specifically, you will: Partner with Senior Director Global Sales Performance Management, APAC VP of Sales & Revenue, Commercial & Sales Leaders to define a SIP strategy which maximizes organizational, team, individual performance and revenue potential. Lead, support and manage change management processes to build organizational understanding and buy-in for  SPM programs and plans, establish support from key leadership stakeholders, and effectively implement plans within APAC. Work closely with senior sales leadership to define the optimal performance measurements, and performance management programs to ensure all are aligned with business and the sales organization objectives. Provide direction and ensure internal sales intelligence is provided to support and measure the effectiveness of the incentive program within APAC. In partnership with Analytics and global SPM team, develops new reporting tools, optimize existing reporting tools as needed for KPI and performance reporting. Work closely with Finance, and Human Resources to establish rules, policies, and procedures associated with the SIP and APAC region. Identify risks and opportunities, and then develop mitigating plans for APAC and escalate as needed to Global lead. Identify, prioritize, and drive the execution of processes that support excellence of Account Management through Salesforce, including dashboards and governance. Participate in requirements gathering, testing, set-up and training for Incentive Compensation Management system (SIP Tool), as it pertains to goal setting and payouts, and ensures system compliance Foster an organization of continual process improvement. Requirements What are we looking for? A Senior Manager, Sales Performance Management - APAC serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow: Minimum five (5) years in analytical role. Minimum three (3) years in role requiring regular presentation to executive leadership. Minimum two (2) years managing staff or vendor relationships. Collaborative team player who can influence internal and external decision makers and work under pressure. Process oriented, organized individual with a keen attention to detail. Able to thrive in a fast-paced, diverse environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Capable of identifying, prioritizing, and articulating highest-impact initiatives and processes. Ability to simultaneously lead multiple projects. Ability to manage their time efficiently and prioritize accordingly, adapting to seasonal needs and time zones of a global Sales Performance team. Ability to define their working pace and balance to deliver on expectations. Salesforce advocate that understands how to make Salesforce platform work for the Sales organization unique needs and optimize utilization. Strong communication skills. Critical thinking and analytical skills. Advanced Excel modeling. MS Office (including Power Point presentation skills). Global Conference call participation (evening or early morning). Leadership Behaviours Proactive enterprise leadership mindset to work across the Commercial Services organization within APAC and Global. Collaborator who will reach out to the business and proactively think through and set up efficient processes to support APAC needs. Global interactions with Senior Leadership roles within APAC and Global – confidence to speak and lead discussions, and ability to demonstrate curiosity and an interest in learning. It would be helpful in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Hotel operations / sales experience. Advance degree, MBA. About the Role The Information Security Manager will play a crucial role in the implementation of the Information Security programs. You will work closely with the Information Security Chief of Staff and collaborate with leadership and technical teams on the continued evolution of Information Security programs across the cybersecurity, and company functions. We are looking for someone who has good knowledge of information security domains, a passion to execute the long-term strategy, and a strong aim to empower others. Self-starter mentality, analytical thinking, good communication, collaboration skills, and attention to detail are key. What You Will Do Support the day-to-day execution of mid to long-term cybersecurity strategies in partnership with leadership, technical teams, including internal and external partners Manage key Information Security program deliverables and report on key security metrics Lead standardized security working groups to drive progress of key initiatives Prepare regular security progress reports and analytics to support decision making Contribute to functional senior management reports Standardize end-to-end processes for strategy execution aligning to mid to long term strategic directions Support budget planning; capacity and headcount planning on program level Collaborate and provide oversight and guidance for periodic security assessments and improvements Provide knowledge and best practices sharing to drive the development of team members Build relationships with stakeholders and leadership across the organization to influence change and drive consistency with Information Security standards What You Will Need Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in Computer Science or Business Management/Administration, or other related field. At least 7 years of relevant experience. CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CISM, GCP, or relevant security certifications strongly preferred. A good combination of technical information security expertise and business experience to understand the intersection of Gojek’s business lines and initiatives to effectively execute security programs Advanced analytical thinking with the ability to construct and articulate meaningful messages Ability and appetite for handling complex and changing environments Excellent communication and presentation skills. Public speaking experience preferred Proven track record of stakeholder engagement for a diverse stakeholder audience Maturity to execute delivery, ensure quality and manage relationships across teams/departments and geographic boundaries Ability to influence, negotiate and partner across multiple projects and teams/departments to achieve a specific agenda About the Team Gojek Information Security function is responsible for providing a secure and trustworthy ecosystem, delivering a world-class security capability while ensuring compliance and, last but not least, making Gojek the safest and trusted platform for our customers as well as the safest workplace for our GoTroops.

About the role: Fasten your helmet and climb aboard if you’re ready to be a (Senior) Data Scientist with us. In this role, you will be an integral player in the Demand and Incentives Data Team based in Singapore. Focusing heavily on bringing our incentive systems to the next level using the latest cutting edge data science techniques, you will employ various quantitative techniques such as Machine Learning, Optimization, Simulation,Reinforcement Learning, Bayesian Techniques, etc. at your disposal to drive asymmetric values for our business at Gojek. Also, you will be involved in ideation, research, and building prototypes. The folks in the Data Science Platform will be your companions on this ride as they’d help to bring your models to production with the Data Science tools they build. Your efforts will directly influence the top line and bottom line of the company What You Will Do Bring the latest of research in Reinforcement Learning and Causal Inference to life and adapt it to the needs of Gojek Write highly reliable code to validate and stress test them, in collaboration with other Data Scientists Communicate with business stakeholders, collaborate to formalize needs and match them with relevant papers or technologies Experiment with algorithms on live data, measure your impact and share your learnings, while upbringing Gojek’s excellence in applied research Work very closely with Data Science Platform to deploy your algorithms and bring business impact Monitor ML infrastructure and work with the respective data science team to drive up efficiency What You Will Need Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related discipline (At least 3 years of experience) Ability to write simple, modular and tested code, even for research code Strong background in statistics, probability and machine learning Power-user of the Python scientific stack (numpy, scipy, pandas, sklearn, plotly,...) Highly proficient in a deep learning framework (eg. Pytorch or Tensorflow) and comfortable with implementing architectures from arxiv Proficient in SQL, source code control systems (git) and basic Unix Excellent written and oral communication skills. You enjoy explaining how models work to a broader audience, in simple terms. About the team: Our Demand and Incentives team is a part of the Loyalty, Incentives, and Monetization (LPM) Data team which consists of 5 members (Data Scientists). The team is distributed across Indonesia, India and Singapore. Working alongside the teams looking after CRM, Growth and Consumer Care (just to name a few), we oversee all things data when it comes to increasing demand and issuing Incentives, including designing an efficient loyalty program and the best data driven communication channels for our users. For instance, should you have a question about which incentives to offer our customers to keep them engaged in the platform, we are your people! Currently, our team has been busy working on Machine Learning based voucher allocations, which will help Gojek to grow in efficient and scalable manners by recommending which incentives to offer our customers at the right time. We are a tight-knit group made up of crypto-enthusiasts, national badminton champion, and movie fanatics!. We work hard and play hard, and believe it or not, we actually enjoy each other’s company!

Working closely with the rest of the Singapore Operations team, you will be helping Gojek provide all our users the delightful experience that they deserve. About the job The Go-to-Market (GTM) function seeks to support the Content Partnerships team to achieve accountability, alignment, efficiency, scale, and speed by focusing on portfolio development priorities and account assignment to help our partners thrive and grow responsibly and achieve YouTube’s organizational level objectives and key results. In this role, you will work closely with the Central GTM team, Product Specialists, and Regional Content Partnerships teams to manage the partnerships goal setting, tracking, and reporting processes. You will also work closely with the APAC Partnerships leadership team and Partnerships Enablement teams to support the account selection and transition processes. You will identify and create goals against opportunities to empower partner-facing teams to drive partner success. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Resposibilities Develop country and regional operating models, set and review goals, coordinate leadership reviews, manage cross-functional meetings and optimize internal processes (review, approval) Develop innovative experiments to improve our go-to-market approach, perform data analyses to define parameters and review efficacy, navigate internal processes and support leadership on decisions to scale experiments Analyze and interpret data, define viewership patterns and growth metrics, identify and deliver strategic and actionable recommendations that help our partners (creators, artists, media companies) operate effectively on YouTube Query data and gather input to derive actionable insights on product usage (including new product launches), integrate feedback into product development roadmap, partner with regional cross-functional teams and global Product teams to tailor product development for the region and increase adoption Provide thought leadership and ensure alignment in global Partnerships Enablement and Go-To-Market forums

Job_Title: Regional Brand and Reputation Marketing Manager, Google Play
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 8 years of experience in tech marketing, brand management, strategy consulting, corporate affairs/Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Preferred qualifications: Experience in creating and leading high-impact meaningful integrated marketing campaigns (offline, online, activation, unconventional and innovative campaigns/activities beyond traditional media buys) Experience organizing and moving large and complex programs forward, identifying clear paths for all parties, and maintaining timelines and goals Leadership experience in managing multiple complex projects and influencing senior stakeholders internally and externally Demonstrated capacity for developing and understanding strategy, driving strategic alignment with stakeholders, and inspiring teams to achieve common goals About the job Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. As the Google Play Regional Brand and Reputation Marketing Manager, your goal will be to build and maintain positive sentiment towards Google Play amongst key opinion formers (KOF) in the broader app ecosystem. You will be our subject matter expert in KOF marketing and protecting the Google Play brand and reputation within the industry. You will work cross-functionally with country marketers, central and global Google Brand and Reputation teams, government affairs, corporate communications, and more. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. Resposibilities Lead in refining the APAC Google Play brand and reputation strategy, identifying priority initiatives, and driving alignment across cross-functional teams Uncover insights about key opinion formers (KOFs) and our ecosystem to inform our brand and reputation strategy and initiatives, and drive consistent measurement of initiatives across the region Lead the rollout of scaled regional programs from conceptualization, strategy, planning to execution of initiatives, management of external agencies, localization of content, partnerships, and communications plans Partner closely with cross-functional teams, in-country marketers, and global stakeholders to bring our APAC strategy to fruition Internalize and bring to life the Google Play brand, voice, mission, and values in a way that is consistent with the broader Google brand voice and strategy

Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Job_Descriptions: ERGO Insurance Pte. Ltd. is a registered general insurer regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. We are a wholly owned Singapore subsidiary of ERGO Group AG, one of the major insurance groups in Germany and Europe, and we are the primary insurance arm of Munich Re, one of the leading reinsurers and risk carriers worldwide. We want to become a leader in the Singapore market by offering innovative insurance solutions that meet the needs of our intermediaries and our mutual customers. We want to underwrite a balanced portfolio of insurance risks that allow us to achieve a profit that is commensurate to our risk appetite and the available risk capital. Within this setting, we want to grow the portfolio and achieve a size that enables the Company to be competitive in the long-term. www.ergo.com.sg We are seeking a highly-motivated individual with professional experience to join our team as an Senior Executive / Assistant Manager / Manager, Information Security Risk Management, reporting to the Chief Risk Officer. Requirements To be successful in this role, you will possess the following experience, knowledge and skills: Degree in Information Security, Computer Science or IT preferred Industry qualifications such as CRISC, CISSP, CISA, COBIT, ITIL preferred. Membership of a professional information security organisation preferred In-depth knowledge of information security solutions, methodology, controls and best practices (such as the NIST framework, ISO27002 etc) Good understanding of insurance operations and systems an advantage 5+ years of relevant work experience (Information Security Officer, IT Auditor etc) Familiarity with the applicable information security regulations in Singapore preferred Experience in working with multitude of stakeholders and teams Job description The successful applicant will: Implement the ERGO Group Information Security frameworks for the Company, including all related policies, guidelines and work instructions Provide insight and identify non-compliance with Group framework or local regulatory requirements and work with the first line to close gaps Support the identification, assessment, and prioritisation of information security threats and work with relevant stakeholders for control enhancement Conduct/review security risk assessments and provide guidance to asset owners in terms of protection needs analysis and liaison with IT to ensure that these protections are implemented Provide regular updates to Executive Commmitee, the Board of Directors and the Segment / Group's CISO on information security risks, mitigation actions, progress of security measures implementation, key information security incidents, and risk assessments Assess, review and challenge first line measures and activities and participate in first line projects as necessary to provide second line of defence oversight Plan, design and implement measures for security education and training in accordance with the Group's frameworks Participate in investigations as requested by Segment / Group CISO office Work with the first line in terms of coordination/support of internal and external information security-related audits Align topics around business continuity management such as Business Impact Analysis and Business Continuity Plan and assist in the update and review of these documents, including participating or organising and developing as part of the business crisis team in the case of an information security incident Assist in the development of BCP tests, exercises and attestations Be part of the Risk Management function and work with the Chief Risk Officer on other risk topics as Statement of Purpose (Overall Purpose of Job) For the purposes of section 28(1) of the WSH (Construction) Act, a workplace safety and health coordinator shall be appointed in respect of every worksite where the contract sum of the building operation or works of engineering construction carried out therein is less than $10 million. Major Duties & Responsibilities (A) Specific: Have an understanding of the Company Health, Safety, Environmental and Quality Policies and responsibilities of each grade of personnel. Ensure the policy is brought to the attention of all the employees under your control and ensure that work is carried out in accordance with its requirements. Review and update the company safety policy and other related duties implemented by the relevant authorities. Liaison with sub-contractors with respect to environmental, health and safety works undertaken by them. Monitor and conduct site safety orientation, daily toolbox meetings and minutes of meeting properly documented, Asset to WSH manager, WSH Officers to investigate every Incident / Accident. Identify WSH hazards, Implement control measures, conduct safety inspection and safety committee meeting. Review safety management system and recommendations for improvement of safety and act as Secretary of the WSH committee, Conduct monthly safety training programme and emergency excavation plan. Carry out site safety, health and environment programmes and procedures. Assist the Safety Manager, Workplace Safety and Health Officer and Environmental Control Officer in all safety, health & environment matters. Checking sub-contractors work to ensure compliance with the WSH (Construction) Regulations. Coordinates and assures compliance with the Risk Assessment Program. Ensure that issuance of personal protective equipment is properly recorded and documented. Maintain required Safety and Health documents or files. Prepare monthly safety report. (B) General: Ensure that all rules and regulations as stipulated in the WSH (Construction) Regulations are met. Ensure that all statutory regulations, company's safety regulations and code of practice are implemented and complied with by all staff. Conduct regular inspection and audits on the safety provisions and Inspect and rectifying any unsafe place of work and unsafe practices . Other duties as assigned . (C) Safety: To follow the safety procedures, rules and regulation and eliminate or reduce hazard at the work place. To identify hazards and implement effective risk control measures. To make sure the work environment is safe. To make sure adequate safety measures are taken for any machinery, equipment, plant, article or process used at the workplace. To make sure systems for dealing with emergencies is in order. Ensure sufficient instruction, training and supervision is provided to work safely. Follow the workplace safety and health system, safe work procedures or safety rules implemented at the workplace. Not to engage in any unsafe or negligent act that may endanger yourself or others working around you. Use personal protective equipment provided to you to ensure your safety while working. Do not tamper with or misuse any equipment. Job Requirements (A) Education, Qualifications & Special Training: Possess valid BCSS. Possess valid WSQ Advanced Certificate in WSH. Possess valid WAH Assessor or Managing WAH. Candidates with First Aid Course Certification will be advantageous. (B) Knowledge & Skills: Compute Knowledge (MSWord, MSXL, MS Power Point) Good communication skills (C) Experience: Relevant experience in WSH Coordinator for a period of not less than one year before the appointment as a WSH Coordinator.

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) is Singapore's fifth autonomous university and was founded with the vision to lead in innovative university education by integrating learning, industry and community. SIT espouses an applied learning approach and offers degrees that focus on industry-relevant science and technology areas. Our faculty work closely with industry on translational research and innovation, as well as providing consultancy to address industry challenges. This well-established nexus with industry endows our graduates with deep skills and work-ready training experience - attuning them to the needs and demands of the future economy. As a young university, we encourage innovation and seek the right candidates to join us in realizing our vision into an increasingly vibrant reality. We offer competitive remuneration, generous employment benefits, access to funding to undertake research of relevance to industry, and the opportunities to inspire and nurture the next generation of skilled and work-ready undergraduates. We currently have positions available at Associate Professor for the following programmes: Civil Engineering / Mining Engineering : Emerging and disruptive construction technologies / High performance construction materials with reduced embodied carbon / Tunnel engineering with expertise in design, construction, operation and impact assessment of tunnels Electrical and Electronics Engineering : Power electronics / Power system analytics / Expertise related to marine / built sector (e.g. electrification of ships or maritime and building energy efficiency) / Digital twinning of electrical / aviation / manufacturing set-ups / Expertise in system design which may include green building design involving passive to active systems or land transport systems Mechanical Engineering / Material Engineering / Marine Engineering : Transport infrastructure asset management / Domain Expertise in maintenance, operation and modelling of infrastructural assets and systems Systems Engineering : Competent in data analytics for power industry or building services / Experience on integrated digital technology such as AR/VR for system maintenance including electrical power and thermal assets in building or shipyard or aviation / Strong Infocomms background for IoT implementation and integration Successful candidates will join the Engineering (ENG) Cluster (one of five domain clusters in SIT), as members of a team of accomplished experts who are passionate about higher education and deeply involved with industry transformation through their applied research programmes. ? Faculty in the ENG Cluster undertake funded industry-relevant research, teach courses in civil, mining, electrical, mechanical, material, marine and systems engineering as well as supervise graduate industry masters and doctorate students in relevant topics. They are also provided with paid leave to undertake consultancy work with industry and/or spend time attached to work with industry. ? We will prioritize collegial and team-spirited candidates with either (a) an earned PhD or equivalent from a reputable university with specialization in any of the above-mentioned areas and some relevant work experience, or (b) extensive industry experience with demonstrated strong technical expertise in the above-mentioned areas.

Description Job Description: The Defense & Intelligence Group of Leidos has an opening for the Navy’s Service Management, Integration and Transport (SMIT) Outside Continental United States (OCONUS) NetOps Specialist in Bahrain. The SMIT contract will provide secure end-to-end Information Technology (IT) services to more than 400,000 hardware devices and 600,000+ users at over 1,600 Continental United States (CONUS) sites and over 82 OCONUS site across Asia, Europe, and the Middle East; constituting one of the largest combined networks in the world. Under the OCONUS Piers portion of the contract, the Leidos team will provide pier side connect/disconnect service, network administration, and fiber optic cable repair supporting US Navy vessels arriving and departing from piers in Europe, the Middle East and Asia. This position will be responsible for monitoring and maintaining the network infrastructure providing connectivity services to vessels in port. This will require the completion of daily checks, performing vulnerability scans, monitoring network connections, resolving and reporting outages, and maintaining the lifecycle replacement of network equipment. The NetOps specialist may also assist in the connect/disconnect process for vessels arriving or departing from piers at their location. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in network administration and ideally experience operating and maintaining Navy networks. Primary Responsibilities: The qualified candidate will Oversee, plan and organize complex operational designs, develop support plans, coordinate implementations, and provide second level support for Local Area Network (LAN), Base Area Network (BAN), and Wide Area Network (WAN) solutions encompassing heterogeneous platforms. Other duties and responsibilities include: Responsible for managing the day-to-day activities of Network Operations, Work with Cyber Security analysts to ensure Enterprise information flow is secure Ensures effective and efficient operation of network systems, architecture and topology Monitor to ensure all operating systems are functioning properly and conform to operation security policies and procedures Receive and analyze network alerts from various sources within the enterprise and determine possible causes of such alerts. Track and document incidents from initial detection through final resolution. Assists with the development and application of business processes to ensure appropriate service levels Develop and implement standards, procedures, and processes for the Network Operations Center Participate in strategic network and operations planning Work within the DevSecOps methodology to plan and support implementation of new technologies Prepare recommendations for resolutions to NetOps challenges based on monitoring results, tools analysis, and/or forensics Assist the Cyber Team employ approved defense-in-depth principles and practices (e.g., defense-in-multiple places, layered defenses, and security robustness). Assist with the collection of intrusion artifacts (e.g., source code, malware, and trojans) and use discovered data to enable mitigation of potential computer network defense (CND) incidents within the enterprise. Develop system support requirements by reviewing and analyzing customer business processes and evaluating available Enterprise Services (ES) and supplier capabilities. Author procedures to maintain security and protect systems from unauthorized use. Lead project teams in implementing new or upgraded designs and coordinate project efforts with support groups. Create plans that support implementation of changes. Participate in system support design and performance evaluation reviews. Advise on distributed network computing issues. Monitor and maintain security and integrity standards and controls. Plan and Assist in the evaluation, testing and recommendation of hardware and network configurations based on customer need. Perform other related duties as assigned. Basic Qualifications HS Diploma and 6 years of directly related work experience in the Information Technology field US Citizen and DoD Secret Clearance Possess a current Information Assurance Technician (IAT) II certification (ex. CompTIA Security+ certification) Must possess at least one of the following certifications: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) - Preferred Microsoft OS Certification (MDAA, MTA, MCP, MCSA, MCSE, etc.) Hands-on Experience in working with DoD networks, including NIPR and SIPR Plans implementation of enhancements and upgrades to the network Advise network users of hardware requirements, configurations and limitations Willing to perform shift work Preferred Qualifications Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Demonstrated hands-on expertise networking technologies and data centers Exceptional communication abilities, both verbal and written, including long-form business writing on complex topics Proven ability to influence and mangers of other service support models and supporting teams Ability to manage globally distributed 24x7 operations to include short-notice travel in response to emerging operational issues Motivated self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to create complex technical reports on analytic findings Pay Range: COVID Response In order to enter Leidos facilities in the U.S. and to attend Leidos events outside our facilities, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 or maintain proof of a negative COVID-19 test within 96 hours of entry. In addition, we are receiving guidance from certain customers that onsite contractor personnel will need to be fully vaccinated to access customer facilities. If you are not vaccinated, please consider getting your COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible. If you have any questions, please contact your Talent Acquisition POC. About Leidos Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, civil, and health markets. The company’s 43,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $12.30 billion for the fiscal year ended January 1, 2021.  For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Location: Funan, 107, North Bridge Road, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179105, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. Job Description : Key Responsibilities To maintain and manage a database of bereavement referrals, undertaking bereavement intake /risk assessments, formulate, implement and evaluate therapeutic interventions for the bereaved. Job_Title: Application Support, Liquidity Cash Management, Associate
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : As an Application Support Associate,you play a key role inproviding our customers and clients with a stable, secure environmentprovided by JPMorgan Chase. You will be part of the global Core Payments and LiquidityTechnology team, basedin Singapore.You willplay a key role in providing daily and critical production support (L1 / L2) to our e-commerce clients who are using our applications, and report significant issues to the leadershipmanagement. While learning to fix application and data issues as they arise, you'll also gain exposure to software development, testing, deployment, maintenance, and improvement, in addition to production lifecycle methodologies and risk guidelines. Finally, you'll have the opportunity to develop professionally and to grow your career in any direction you choose! Responsibilities Perform Incident, Problem and Change Management activities Manage, track and validate all changes to the Production, Disaster Recovery environment Manage priority incidents and leverage cross-functional teams to quickly eliminate impacts Escalate issues/Risks effectively when necessary across supporting framework Troubleshoot Key technical issues or escalate and work with appropriate technology teams to provide solutions Aggressively respond to service requests from Client facing support teams, Operations partners, etc. Manage application and infrastructure to maximize stability and resiliency. Leverage and improve monitoring and alerting capabilities to ensure application SLAs are met Strong focus on automation and processes. Design, implement, improve and utilize key monitoring tools Develop, test and debug automated tasks (Apps, Systems, Infrastructure) Troubleshoot priority incidents and facilitate blameless post-mortems Work with development teams throughout the software life cycle ensuring sustainable software releases Perform analytics on previous incidents and usage patterns to better predict issues and take proactive actions Build and drive adoption for greater self-healing and resiliency patterns Participate in the weekend support coverage in a rotational shift with fellow team members Qualifications and Skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or, Engineering, Information Systems or related disciplines Minimum 5 years of working experience in L1 & L2 support role, experience in application development will be an added advantage Experience in using at least one of the relational database (SQL Server, Oracle, DB2 etc.) Experience in instrumentation, customization and usage of at least couple of modern monitoring toolset such as Dynatrace, AppDynamics, Grafana, Prometheus, ThousandEyes, Splunk, Geneos etc. Working knowledge of Batch scripting, Ansible, PowerShell or Shell Scripting Expertise utilizing one of the batch scheduling tools such as Control-M or Autosys Working knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. networking, cloud services, orchestration tools, containerization, compute and storage systems) Experience in executing and driving Resiliency events Comfortable working in Agile mode andContinuous Integration and Continuous Delivery Excellent debugging and trouble shooting skills Understanding of architecture and design of application systems Working proficiency in developmental toolsets Preferred skills but not mandatory Experience working in the banking and financial services, or a fast paced technology environment

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment. As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Full vaccination is a requirement for this role for new hires joining JPMorgan Chase . Additional requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool and may include mask wearing and social distancing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law. Job_Title: APAC Human Resources Business Advisory, Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : The HR Business Advisor, Vice President position represents the opportunity to work closely with and provide strategic HR advisory and support to clients withinAPAC Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB). This position requires a strong HR professional who thrives in a demanding, fast paced global environment. It is important for the individual to be able to operate effectively within a highly matrixorganization and be able to leverage resources from multiple areas to deliver results.This role will identify and develop solutions based on business priorities and organizational analysis whilst overseeing the implementation of HR policies, programs and services. Key Accountabilities / Major Responsibilities: Working in partnership with business stakeholders to consult with, provide advice and recommendations on a full spectrum of HR activities, i.e. people management, employee relations, compensation, staffing, performance management, career and talent management, employee counselling, HR policies & procedures, learning & development Provide creative and pragmatic advice/ guidance to business stakeholders to effectively manage and resolve human capital issues whilst ensuring all actions confirm to regulatory/ legislative best practice and corporate policies. Work with management information systems (MIS) and reporting to understand trends and outliers, and facilitate fact based, metrics driven client decisions In partnership with appropriate specialist groups both locally and regionally, stay current on best practices. Tailor and implement those best suited for the business including recruitment, diversity, compensation and benefits, development initiatives and expatriate moves Provide Employee Relations advice - analyze complex HR issues and recommend solutions in a timely fashion following established guidelines. Support and coach managers on matters including flexible working arrangements, absence and sickness, grievances, disciplinary issues and redundancies Facilitate the compensation process including maintaining data integrity, analyzing and auditing data, educating managers on the firm's compensation philosophy and year end communications, and coaching managers in making fair, robust and well differentiated decisions around employee pay Co-ordinate talent management programs: identify future leaders, succession plans, promotion candidates, competency gaps, mobility opportunities and diverse talent. Provide project management support for HR-related initiatives being implemented within LOBs and provide support cross-LOB and large-scale initiatives Partner with HR colleagues of all levels to drive efficiencies and leverage best practices Ensure appropriate controls are in place and managed effectively for all critical HR processes Lead and/or actively participate in HR projects, aligned to key identified HR priorities Qualifications & Experience Required: Minimum of bachelors degree or equivalent Minimum 8yearsof overall HR experience is required, previous HR Business Partner experience preferred Knowledge of full range of people practices in a business setting: goal setting, performance assessment and improvement, compensation practices, talent review and talent management, workforce planning, reductions in force, manager development Project management abilities including execution skills and end to end process improvement Ability to utilize critical thinking and analytical skills regularly to identify issues and trends, develop solutions and/or recommendations to address root cause Strong analytical, quantitative and technical skills that enable individual to leverage data to create HR strategies that support and drive business results Ability to navigate a global matrix organization and partner on issues across HR and the business Must be able to work collaboratively and to develop strong, positive working relationships Proven track record in objectively coaching employees and management through complex, difficult issues and mitigating risks Exceptional judgment, demonstrated ability to make sound decisions and be creative in developing alternative solutions in a fast-paced environment Promote partnership by fostering a shared purpose, trust and teamwork across teams, businesses, functions, regions, and levels

Job Description : As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. The Macro eTrading team partners with several Rates and Emerging Markets (EM) businesses to provide solutions for electronic trading on client markets. We are based predominantly in London and NYC but also maintain a presence in Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney and Mumbai, and the businesses we support span the globe. We cover several functional domains including pricing, contribution, execution, and STP, and manage the entire SDLC. As such, we are a diverse group of project managers, business analysts, and developers (front-end and back-end). Our systems facilitate the electronic trading of many products on the client markets, the majority of which are securities and derivatives. We are looking for a developer to work on several exciting projects for the Rates and EM businesses inAPAC. The projects cover both BAU and transformation initiatives, touching everything from pricing to STP, from the front-end to the back-end. The ideal candidate would have experience working in development in markets, either at an investment bank or something similar. Other relevant development experience, however, will be considered. The candidate must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and be able to work with a geographically diverse team. Responsibilities Understand requirements, solve technical problems, propose complete solutions Design, develop and test software following standard SDLC Support PMs, BAs and management as technical SME Define and implement non-functional requirements Help team identify improvements to make to our systems and processes This role a requires wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: BS/BA degree Minimum 7 years of work experience, in which minimum 5 years in Finance IT industry Minimum5 years hands-on development working experience in Java / Python / C++, SQL, Unix, Spring Professional experience on Trading application in Fixed-Income, Macro, Equities, Credit Professional experience working with Traders, Sales and Operation Understanding on the below is required: Multi-Threading Socket Programming couple Connectivity Protocols, like FIX Low-Latency event-driven systems Front-end technologies like C#, JavaScript, HTML5, Angular Design Patterns and Software Architectures Energetic, motivated and determined Pragmatic and results-oriented Adaptable to diverse set of technical responsibilities Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Productive and able to manage time effectively Knowledge in the below will be preferred: Electronic trading systems TIBCO RV, LBM, JMS or other messaging middleware KDB+ or other tick databases Distributed caches

Such documents are to be reviewed by Investors prior to delivery. Risk Items Monitoring - Assist Investment Team Lead on monitoring Reg 9 reviews, suitability reviews, post trade alerts, and tracking follow ups. Provide basic client information management Prepare and review prospect/banking products pitches Periodic updating of client backgrounds Client invitation/nominations for events Client applications for investment programs Daily account administration: unblocking of accounts, setting up credit lines Requirements: Bachelor's degree any discipline Minimum 1 year experience in Private Bank PowerPoint and Excel expertise required Excellent interpersonal skills, both written and oral Self-starter, extremely organized and detailed-oriented with strong commitment to accuracy Ability to multi-task and manage priorities effectively Good judgment and problem solving skills Absolute discretion when dealing with confidential matters Ability to work both independently and as a team player Exceptional follow-up and follow-through skills General comfort level with Internet/Intranet usage and ability to learn proprietary software Alongside fluent English, proficiency in Mandarin and Cantonese language skill will be a plus as the job holder is required to liaise with stakeholders from China
